_desc.NAICS_DESCRIPTION: Polish and Other Sanitation Good Manufacturing

_exec_summary.SummaryText:
OnLine Packaging, Inc. manufactures bleach and windshield washer solution at their plant in Michigan City, Indiana.  Chlorine, a substance considered hazardous by the Environmental Protection Agency (EPA), is used to manufacture bleach at this facility.  Because chlorine is a regulated substance, OnLine Packaging, Inc. must comply with the EPA's Chemical Accident Prevention regulations (40 CFR Part 68).  Compliance involves developing and implementing a risk management plan (RMP), and submitting this RMP to the EPA.



At the OnLine Packaging, Inc. plant in Michigan City, Indiana, the maximum inventory of chlorine on site is a 90-ton tank car located on a railroad spur adjacent to the building.  Liquid chlorine is piped from the tank car into the building where it is reacted, under carefully controlled conditions, with caustic soda to produce bleach for consumer use.  The chlorine systems are designed and operated in accordance with Chlorine Institute recommendations, and the employees of OnLine Packaging, Inc. use appropriate safety precautions in handling chlorine to prevent accidental releases and minimize any hazards to human health and the environment.



The Michigan City plant has been in operation since 2002 and has never had an accidental release of chlorine in any quantity.  OnLine Packaging, Inc. also operates plants in Plover, Wisconsin, and Ardmore, Oklahoma, neither of which have ever had an accidental release of chlorine of any reportable quantity.



In the event of an emergency involving chlorine, this emergency response plan calls for certain internal procedures and actions to be taken in addition to the immediate notification of the Michigan City Fire Department, the LaPorte County Emergency Management of Homeland Security Department (LaPorte LEPC), the National Emergency Response Center, and INFOTRAC. A Contingency Emergency Response Plan is implemented by the CPSP Team any time there is a threat or occurrence of fire, explosion, weather emergenc

y, or release of hazardous substances to the environment.  The plan is designed to minimize the hazards to human health or the environment and to establish notification and mobilization procedures to be implemented during emergency conditions.



OnLine Packaging, Inc. complies with the EPA's Chemical Accident Prevention regulations and with all applicable state codes and regulations.  No changes are planned at this time that will alter the effectiveness of this RMP.  However, if continued operations indicate the need, changes will be implemented, and this RMP will be updated to ensure continued compliance with EPA standards.
